data.title: Facebook has more users in India than anywhere else. It's now dealing with a hate speech crisis
data.text: Facebook is facing multiple simultaneous controversies in the United States, particularly around disinformation, hate speech and political bias. But those issues are also playing out — sometimes in more sinister ways — around the world, including a country where Facebook has more users than anywhere else.

data.title: Facebook prepared to restrict posts if US election gets extremely chaotic, report says
data.text: Facebook executive Nick Clegg tells the Financial Times that the social network has plans ready for a range of outcomes to the November election.

data.title: Facebook Is a Good Value as Free Cash Flow Ramps Up
data.text: Facebook looks like good value here. Facebook stock is worth at least one third more based on its historical FCF margins, FCF yield and P/E.

data.title: Facebook says it may quit Europe over ban on sharing data with US
data.text: EU court in July ruled there were insufficient safeguards against snooping by US intelligence agencies

data.title: Facebook exec says company is preparing for Election Day chaos
data.text: Facebook has some “break-glass options” if November’s presidential election results in chaos, a top executive said. Nick Clegg, Facebook’s head of global affairs, told the Financial Times that the social network has drawn up contingency plans “if there really is an extremely chaotic and, worse still, violent set of circumstances” following the vote.

data.title: One of the founders of Facebook's libra digital currency has left the company
data.text: Morgan Beller, also a co-founder of Novi payments wallet, has left  Facebook before the release of the technology.

data.title: Facebook Set To Restrict Content If Election Day Descends Into Chaos Or Violence
data.text: Facebook has multiple plans on how to handle a range of outcomes on Election Day, company executive Nick Clegg said.

data.title: Machine Learning Answers: Facebook Stock Is Down 20% In A Month, What Are The Chances It’ll Rebound?
data.text: Facebook stock reached an all-time high of almost $305 less than a month ago before a larger sell-off in the technology industry drove the stock price down nearly 20% to its current level of around $250. But will the company’s stock continue its downward trajectory over the coming weeks.

data.title: What is Ray-Ban thinking hitching its brand to Facebook?
data.text:
The brand image trade-off in the multiyear deal between Facebook and Ray-Ban parent EssilorLuxottica is as lopsided as a pair of busted glasses.
When Mark Zuckerberg came on screen to launch the Facebook Connect virtual conference last week, he outlined the company’s goals when it came to the innovation and proliferation of virtual and augmented reality.

data.title: Facebook suspends environmental groups despite vow to fight misinformation
data.text: Facebook blames mistake in system for restrictions on groups including Greenpeace USA
